intro: Cyrtandra megastigmata, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue and white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts in Hawaii.
